translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هدف این است که ما آنان را با این نعمت فراوان بیازمائیم، و هر کس از ذکر و یاد پروردگارش روی‌گردان گردد، او را به عذاب سخت و طاقت فرسائی داخل می‌گرداند. [[«یَسْلُکْهُ»: داخل می‌گرداند (نگا: قصص / 32، حاقّه / 32). «صَعَداً»: سخت. غیر قابل تحمّل. طاقت‌فرسا.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: تا سرانجام در آن بیازماییمشان، و هر کس از یاد پروردگارش دل بگرداند، او را به عذابی سهمگین بکشاند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هدف این است که ما آنها را با این نعمت فراوان بیازماییم؛ و هر کس از یاد پروردگارش روی گرداند، او را به عذاب شدید و فزاینده‌ای گرفتار می‌سازد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: تا بیازماییمشان در آن و آنکو روی برتابد از یاد پروردگار خویش ببردش در عذابی سخت‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: تا در باره آن بيازماييمشان، و هر كه از ياد و پند پروردگارش روى بگرداند او را به عذابى سخت درآرد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: تا در این‌باره آنان را آزمایشی آتشین بنماییم و هرکس از یاد پروردگارش روی گرداند وی را در قید عذابی بسی بالا و بلند فرو می‌نهد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: In order to try them through it. But whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, will be given increasing torment by Him."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: ‘In order to test them with it; and whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord – He will put him in a punishment that keeps on increasing.’

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: that We might try them therein. And whosoever turns away from the Remembrance of his Lord, He will thrust him into chastisement rigorous.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: That We might try them there by. And whosoever turneth aside from the remembrance of his Lord, him He shall thrust into a torment vehement.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: That We might try them thereby. And whosoever turns away from the Reminder of his Lord (i.e. this Quran, and practice not its laws and orders), He will cause him to enter in a severe torment (i.e. Hell).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: To test them with it. Whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will direct him to torment ever mounting.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: so that We might try them through this bounty. Whoso turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will cause him to suffer a grievous chastisement;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: That We might try them thereby. And whosoever turns away from the Reminder of his Lord, He will cause him to enter in a Sa`ad torment.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: That We may test them thereby, and whoso turneth away from the remembrance of his Lord; He will thrust him into ever-growing torment.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: so that We may test them therein, and whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will let him into an escalating punishment.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and tested them with it. And whosoever turns away from his Lord's Remembrance, He will hurl him into a stern punishment.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So We might test them therein. And whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord He will put into arduous punishment.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: as a trial for them. God will make those who disregard the guidance from their Lord suffer increasing torment.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So that We might try them with respect to it; and whoever turns aside from the reminder of his Lord, He will make him enter into an afflicting chastisement:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Linaftinahum feehi waman yuAArid AAan thikri rabbihi yaslukhu AAathaban saAAadan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: so that We may test them by it -- whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord shall be sternly punished.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "That We might try them by that (means). But if any turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will cause him to undergo a severe Penalty.

verses.text: وَ أَنَ‌ الْمَسَاجِدَ لِلَّهِ‌ فَلاَ تَدْعُوا مَعَ‌ اللَّهِ‌ أَحَداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و مساجد ویژه خداست، پس هیچ کس را با خدا مپرستید،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و مسجدها از آنِ خداست. و با وجود خداى يكتا كسى را به خدايى مخوانيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اين كه مساجد ويژه‌ى خداست، پس هيچ كس را با خدا نخوانيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و مساجد ويژه خداست، پس هيچ كس را با خدا مخوانيد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و مساجد مخصوص (پرستش ذات یکتای) خداست پس نباید با خدا احدی غیر او را پرستش کنید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مسجدها مختصّ پرستش خدا است، و (در آنها) کسی را با خدا پرستش نکنید. [[«أَنَّ الْمَسَاجِدَ لِلّهِ»: مساجد از آن خدا است. مراد این است که مساجد مختصّ عبادت خدا است، لذا در آنها کسی را با خدا عبادت نکنید. «لا تَدْعُوا»: مپرستید. عبادت نکنید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و همه مسجدها خاص خداوند است، پس در جنب خداوند هیچ کس را [به پرستش‌] مخوان‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و اینکه مساجد از آن خداست، پس هیچ کس را با خدا نخوانید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و آنکه سجده‌گاه‌ها از آن خدا است پس نخوانید با خدا کسی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و همانا مسجدها- يا اندامهاى سجده- براى خداست، پس با خداى يكتا كسى را مخوانيد- نپرستيد-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اینکه مساجد، به‌راستی ویژه‌ی خداست. پس هیچ کس را با خدا مخوانید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: All places of worship are for God; so do not invoke any one with God.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: ‘And that the mosques are for Allah only – therefore do not worship anyone along with Allah.’

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: The places of worship belong to God; so call not, along with God, upon anyone.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And the prostrations are for Allah; wherefore call not along with Allah anyone.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And the mosques are for Allah (Alone), so invoke not anyone along with Allah.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: The places of worship are for God. So do not call, besides God, upon anyone else.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and that “mosques belong to Allah, so do not invoke anyone with Him”;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And the Masjids are for Allah, so invoke not anyone along with Allah.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And the places of worship are only for Allah, so pray not unto anyone along with Allah.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: The places of worship belong to Allah, so do not invoke anyone along with Allah.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Mosques belong to Allah, so do not call to anyone else, other than Allah.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And [He revealed] that the masjids are for Allah, so do not invoke with Allah anyone.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: All the parts of the body to be placed on the ground during prostration belong to God.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And that the mosques are Allah's, therefore call not upon any one with Allah:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waanna almasajida lillahi fala tadAAoo maAAa Allahi ahadan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: The mosques are for God's worship -- so do not invoke anyone else along with God --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "And the places of worship are for Allah (alone): So invoke not any one along with Allah;

verses.text: وَ أَنَّهُ‌ لَمَّا قَامَ‌ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ‌ يَدْعُوهُ‌ کَادُوا يَکُونُونَ‌ عَلَيْهِ‌ لِبَداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اینکه هنگامی که بنده خدا [محمّد] برمی خاست تا خدا را عبادت کند [از جنیان به اندازه ای به سویش هجوم می بردند که] نزدیک بود جمعیت انبوه و متراکمی بر سر او بریزد،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون بنده خدا براى پرستش او بر پاى ايستاد، گرد او را گرفتند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اين كه چون بنده‌ى خدا [پيامبر به عبادت‌] برخاست تا او را بخواند، نزديك بود كه [به ازدحام‌] بر سر او فرو افتند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و همين كه «بنده خدا» برخاست تا او را بخواند، چيزى نمانده بود كه بر سر وى فرو افتند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و چون بنده خاصّ خدا (محمّد صلّی اللّه علیه و آله و سلّم) قیام کرد و خدا را می‌خواند طایفه جنّیان (برای استماع قرآن) چنان گرد او ازدحام کردند که نزدیک بود بر سر هم فرو ریزند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (به من وحی شده است که) چون بنده‌ی خدا (محمّد) بر پای ایستاد (و شروع به نماز و خواندن قرآن در آن کرد) و به پرستش خداوند پرداخت، کافران پیرامون او تنگِ یکدیگر ازدحام کردند. [[«عَبْدُاللهِ»: مراد حضرت محمّد است. «لِبَد»: جمع لِبْدَة، متراکم و انباشته. مجازاً به معنی گروه و دسته تنگ یکدیگر و پشت سر هم است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و چنین بود که چون بنده خدا [محمد -ص-] او را به نیایش می‌خواند، نزدیکشان بود که بر سر او بریزند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و اینکه هنگامی که بنده خدا [= محمّد (ص)] به عبادت برمی‌خاست و او را می‌خواند، گروهی پیرامون او بشدّت ازدحام می‌کردند!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و آنکه هنگامی که بپای خاست بنده خدا تا بخواندش نزدیک بود بشوند بر او انبوه‌هایی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و چون بنده خدا- پيامبر

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اینکه چون بنده‌ی خدا به‌راستی، برخاست، حال آنکه خدا را می‌خواند، چیزی نمانده بود که بر سر و رویش فرو افتند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When the devotee of God stood up to invoke Him (the jinns) crowded upon him (to listen).

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: ‘And that when Allah’s bondman stood up to worship Him, the jinns had almost crowded upon him.’”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: When the servant of God stood calling on Him, they were wellnigh upon him in swarms.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And when the bondman of Allah stood calling upon Him, they well nigh pressed on him stifling.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (It has been revealed to me that) When the slave of Allah (Muhammad SAW) stood up invoking (his Lord Allah) in prayer to Him they (the jinns) just made round him a dense crowd as if sticking one over the other (in order to listen to the Prophet's recitation).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And when the servant of God got up calling on Him, they almost fell on him in a mass.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and when Allah's servant stood up to call on Him, they well-nigh swarmed him.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And when the servant of Allah stood up invoking Him in prayer they just made round him a dense crowd as if sticking one over the other.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And when the slave of Allah stood up in prayer to Him, they crowded on him, almost stifling.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: When the servant of Allah rose to pray to Him, they almost crowded around him.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: When the worshiper of Allah stood supplicating to Him, they swarmed around him (Prophet Muhammad).

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And that when the Servant of Allah stood up supplicating Him, they almost became about him a compacted mass."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do not prostrate before anyone other than Him. When the servant of God (Muhammad) preached (his message) the jinn would all crowd around him.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And that when the servant of Allah stood up calling upon Him, they wellnigh crowded him (to death).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waannahu lamma qama AAabdu Allahi yadAAoohu kadoo yakoonoona AAalayhi libadan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: when God's servant stood up to pray to Him, they pressed close to him in great numbers, almost stifling him.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Yet when the Devotee of Allah stands forth to invoke Him, they just make round him a dense crowd."

verses.text: قُلْ‌ إِنَّمَا أَدْعُو رَبِّي‌ وَ لاَ أُشْرِکُ‌ بِهِ‌ أَحَداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: من فقط پروردگارم را می پرستم، و هیچ کس را شریک او قرار نمی دهم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati

translations.text: بگو: «من براى شما اختيار زيان و هدايتى را ندارم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و باز بگو: من مالک و قادر بر خیر و شرّ شما نیستم.

translations.text: بگو من نه صاحب اختیار زیانی برای شما هستم، نه سامانی‌

translations.text: بگو همانا من ندارم برای شما زیان و نه سودی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: من براى شما نه هيچ زيانى را در توان دارم و نه هيچ رهنمونى به خير و صلاح و كمالى را [بى‌هدايت خدا].

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «من هرگز برای شما مالک هیچ زیان و سودی نیستم.»

translations.text: Say: "Neither is your loss within my power nor bringing you to guidance."

translations.text: Say: "It is not in my power to cause you harm, or to bring you to right conduct."

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: [اگر از او نافرمانی کنم] هرگز کسی در برابر [عذاب] خدا مرا پناه نمی دهد، و هرگز پناهگاهی غیر او نمی یابم.

translations.text: بگو: هيچ كس مرا از عقوبت خدا پناه ندهد و من جز او پناهگاهى نمى‌يابم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: هرگز كسى مرا از [عقوبت‌] خدا پناه نمى‌دهد، و هرگز پناهگاهى جز او نخواهم يافت

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «هرگز كسى مرا در برابر خدا پناه نمى‌دهد و هرگز پناهگاهى غير از او نمى‌يابم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: باز بگو که (اگر خدا بر من قهر و غضب کند) ابدا کسی مرا از (قهر) خدا در پناه نتواند گرفت و به غیر او هیچ گریز گاهی هرگز نخواهم یافت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بگو: (اگر من از خدا نافرمانی کنم) هیچ کس مرا در برابر (خشم) خدا پناه نمی‌دهد، و پناهگاهی (برای حفظ خود از عذاب خدا) جز خدا نمی‌یابم. translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «(اگر من نیز بر خلاف فرمانش رفتار کنم) هیچ کس مرا در برابر او حمایت نمی‌کند و پناهگاهی جز او نمی‌یابم؛

translations.text: بگو: همانا مرا هيچ كس از [عذاب‌] خداى پناه و زنهار ندهد- اگر در باره من عذابى خواسته باشد- و هرگز جز او پناهگاهى نيابم،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «هرگز کسی مرا در برابر خدا پناه نمی‌دهد و هرگز پناهگاهی غیر از او نمی‌یابم.»

translations.text: Say: "No one can save me from God, nor can I find a place of refuge apart from Him,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: 'verily none can protect me from Allah, nor can I find beside Him any refuge.

translations.text: Say (O Muhammad SAW): "None can protect me from Allah's punishment (if I were to disobey Him), nor should I find refuge except in Him.

translations.text: Say: “None can protect me from Allah, nor can I find a refuge apart from Him.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: "None can protect me from Allah's punishment, nor can I find refuge except in Him."

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [وظیفه من] فقط رساندن [برنامه های سعادت بخش] از سوی خدا و [رساندن] پیام های اوست. و آنان که از خدا و پیامبرش نافرمانی کنند، مسلماً آتش دوزخ برای آنان است و در آن جاودانه و همیشگی اند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنچه مى‌توانم جز رساندن پيام او و انجام دادن رسالتهاى او نيست. و هر كه خدا و پيامبرش را نافرمانى كند، نصيب او آتش جهنم است كه همواره در آن خواهند بود،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [آنچه مى‌توانم‌] تنها ابلاغى از جانب خدا و رساندن پيام‌هاى اوست. و هر كه خدا و رسولش را نافرمانى كند، قطعا براى او آتش جهنم است كه جاودانه در آن خواهند ماند

translations.text: [وظيفه من‌] تنها ابلاغى از خدا و [رساندن‌] پيامهاى اوست.» و هر كس خدا و پيامبرش را نافرمانى كند قطعاً آتش دوزخ براى اوست و جاودانه در آن خواهند ماند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: تنها مأمن و پناه من ابلاغ احکام خدا و رسانیدن پیغام الهی است، و آنان که نافرمانی خدا و رسول او کنند البته کیفرشان آتش دوزخ است که در آن تا ابد مخلّد باشند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: لیکن (تنها کاری که می‌توانم بکنم) تبلیغ از سوی خدا، و رساندن پیامهای او است. هر کس از خدا و پیغمبرش نافرمانی کند، نصیب او آتش دوزخ است و جاودانه در آن می‌ماند. [[«بَلاغاً»: ابلاغ تبلیغ. مستثنی از (لآ أَمْلِکُ) است و جملات میان آنها معترضه و برای تأکیدِ عدم استطاعت است (نگا: قاسمی). یا این که مفعول مطلق فعل محذوفی است. «رِسَالاتِهِ»: مراد از رسالتهای خدا توضیح مسائل مجمل قرآنی، در پرتو رهنمودهای آسمانی است. مثل توضیح و بیان احکام نماز و زکات و حجّ، و غیره (نگا: المصحف‌المیسّر).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [در اختیار ندارم‌] مگر پیامی از جانب خداوند و رسالت او، و هر کس از خداوند و پیامبر او سرپیچی کند، او راست آتش دوزخ که جاودانه در آن ماند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: تنها وظیفه من ابلاغ از سوی خدا و رساندن رسالات اوست؛ و هر کس نافرمانی خدا و رسولش کند، آتش دوزخ از آن اوست و جاودانه در آن می‌مانند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: جز رساندنی از خدا و پیامهایش و آنکه نافرمانی کند خدا و پیمبرش را هر آینه او را است آتش دوزخ جاودان در آن همیشه‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: جز تبليغى از جانب خداى و رساندن پيامهاى او- كه تنها پناه من است-. و آنان كه خداى و پيامبرش را نافرمانى كنند، ايشان راست آتش دوزخ كه براى هميشه در آن جاويدان باشند.

translations.text: Unless I convey from God and deliver His message." For those who disobey God and His Apostle is the fire of Hell, where they will abide for ever;

translations.text: “I only convey the commands from Allah, and His messages; and whoever disobeys the commands of Allah and His Noble Messenger – then indeed for him is the fire of hell, in which they will remain for ever and ever.”

translations.text: Mine is but the publishing from Allah and His messages; and whosoever disobeyeth Allah and His apostle, his portion verily is the Hell-Fire as abiders therein for evermore.

translations.text: Except for a proclamation from God and His messages. He who defies God and His Messenger—for him is the Fire of Hell, in which they will dwell forever.”

translations.text: (My task is no more than) to deliver Allah's proclamation and His messages. And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger, surely the Fire of Hell awaits him; therein he will abide in perpetuity.”

translations.text: "(Mine is) but conveyance from Allah and His Messages, and whosoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger, then verily, for him is the fire of Hell, he shall dwell therein forever."

translations.text: (Mine is) but conveyance (of the Truth) from Allah, and His messages; and whoso disobeyeth Allah and His messenger, lo! his is fire of hell, wherein such dwell for ever.

translations.text: [I have no duty] except to transmit from Allah, and [to communicate] His messages; and whoever disobeys Allah and His apostle, there will indeed be for him the fire of hell, to remain in it forever.’

translations.text: except a deliverance from Allah and His Messages. He who disobeys Allah and His Messenger, for him is the Fire of Gehenna, which he will be in for ever.

translations.text: (It is) only a delivering (of communications) from Allah and His messages; and whoever disobeys Allah and His Apostle surely he shall have the fire of hell to abide therein for a long time.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Illa balaghan mina Allahi warisalatihi waman yaAAsi Allaha warasoolahu fainna lahu nara jahannama khalideena feeha abadan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: My duty is only to convey that which I receive from Him and His messages." For those who disobey God and His Messenger there is the fire of hell, wherein they will abide forever.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Unless I proclaim what I receive from Allah and His Messages: for any that disobey Allah and His Messenger,- for them is Hell: they shall dwell therein for ever."

verses.text: حَتَّى‌ إِذَا رَأَوْا مَا يُوعَدُونَ‌ فَسَيَعْلَمُونَ‌ مَنْ‌ أَضْعَفُ‌ نَاصِراً وَ أَقَلُ‌ عَدَداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [اینان همواره شما را ضعیف و ناتوان و بی یار می شمارند] تا زمانی که آنچه را [از عذاب] وعده داده می شوند ببینند، پس به زودی آگاه می شوند چه کسی یاورش ناتوان تر و نفراتش کمتر است؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: تا آنگاه كه آنچه را به آنها وعده داده بودند بنگرند. پس خواهند دانست چه كسى را ياران ناتوان‌تر و شمار كمتر بوده است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: تا آن‌گاه كه آنچه را وعده داده مى‌شوند ببينند، پس به زودى خواهند دانست چه كسى از جهت [داشتن‌] ياور ضعيف‌تر و در عدد كم جمعيت‌تر است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [باش‌] تا آنچه را وعده داده مى‌شوند ببينند، آنگاه دريابند كه ياور چه كسى ضعيف‌تر و كدام يك شماره‌اش كمتر است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (ای رسول، کافران را رها کن) تا روزی که عذاب موعود خود را به چشم ببینند، آن زمان خواهند دانست که (تو و آنها) کدامتان یارانش ضعیف و ناتوان‌تر و سپاهش کمتر است؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (کافران همواره به استهزاء خود ادامه می‌دهند) تا زمانی که مشاهده خواهند کرد چیزی را که بدانان وعده داده شده است. آن گاه خواهند دانست که چه کسی (از کافر و مؤمن) یاورانش ناتوانتر، و شماره و تعدادش کمتر است. [[«حَتّی إِذَا رَأَوْا»: (نگا: مریم / 75). «نَاصِراً»: تمییز است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: تا هنگامی رسد که آنچه به آنان وعده داده شده است، ببینند، و زودا بدانند که چه کسی سست یاورتر و اندک سپاه‌تر است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (این کار شکنی کفّار همچنان ادامه می‌یابد) تا آنچه را به آنها وعده داده شده ببینند؛ آنگاه می‌دانند چه کسی یاورش ضعیفتر و جمعیّتش کمتر است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: تا گاهی که دیدند آنچه را وعده داده شوند زود است بدانند کیست ناتوان‌تر یاور و کیست کمتر بشمار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: تا آنگاه كه آنچه به آنها وعده داده شده ببينند خواهند دانست كه چه كسى را يارانى ناتوان‌تر و به شمار كمتر است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «تا هنگامی‌که آن چه را وعده داده می‌شوند ببینند. پس به زودی دریابند که یاور چه کسی کمکش ضعیف‌تر و کدام یک شمار‌ش کمتر است.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Until they see what they are promised, when they will understand who is weaker in aid and poorer in numbers.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Till the time when they will see what they are promised – so they will now come to know whose aide is weak, and who is lesser in number.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Until, when they see that which they are promised, then they will know who is weaker in helpers and fewer in numbers.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They shall go on denying until they; behold that which they are promised wherefore then they shall know who were weaker in protectors and fewer in number.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Till, when they see that which they are promised, then they will know who it is that is weaker concerning helpers and less important concerning numbers.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Until, when they see what they were promised, they will know who is weaker in helpers, and fewer in numbers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (They shall not change their ways) until they see that against which they had been warned, and then they will know whose helpers are weaker and whose supporters are fewer in number.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Till, when they see that which they are promised, then they will know who it is that is weaker concerning helpers and less important concerning numbers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Till (the day) when they shall behold that which they are promised (they may doubt); but then they will know (for certain) who is weaker in allies and less in multitude.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: When they see what they are promised, they will know who is weaker in supporters and fewer in numbers.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: When they see that which they were promised they shall know who is weaker in helpers and fewer in numbers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [The disbelievers continue] until, when they see that which they are promised, then they will know who is weaker in helpers and less in number.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (On the Day of Judgment) when the disbelievers witness that with which they have been threatened, they will then know whose helpers are weaker and fewer in number.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Until when they see what they are threatened with, then shall they know who is weaker in helpers and fewer in number.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Hatta itha raaw ma yooAAadoona fasayaAAlamoona man adAAafu nasiran waaqallu AAadadan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: When they are confronted by what they have been promised, they will realize who is weaker in helpers and fewer in numbers.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: At length, when they see (with their own eyes) that which they are promised,- then will they know who it is that is weakest in (his) helper and least important in point of numbers.

verses.text: قُلْ‌ إِنْ‌ أَدْرِي‌ أَ قَرِيبٌ‌ مَا تُوعَدُونَ‌ أَمْ‌ يَجْعَلُ‌ لَهُ‌ رَبِّي‌ أَمَداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: نمی دانم آیا آنچه را وعده داده می شوید نزدیک است یا پروردگارم برای آن زمانی طولانی قرار خواهد داد؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: من نمى‌دانم كه آيا آن وعده‌اى كه به شما داده‌اند نزديك است، يا پروردگار من براى آن زمانى نهاده است؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: من نمى‌دانم كه آيا آنچه وعده داده مى‌شويد نزديك است يا پروردگارم براى آن مدتى قرار مى‌دهد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «نمى‌دانم آنچه را كه وعده داده شده‌ايد نزديك است يا پروردگارم براى آن زمانى نهاده است؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بگو: من خود ندانم که عذاب موعود شما وقتش نزدیک است یا خدا تا آن روز مدتی (بسیار) قرار داده است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بگو: (ای کافران!) من نمی‌دانم آیا چیزی که به شما وعده داده می‌شود، نزدیک است، یا این که پروردگارم زمان طولانی و زیادی را برای آن در نظر گرفته است. [[«مَا تُوعَدُونَ»: آنچه به شما وعده داده می‌شود، مراد قیامت و عذاب آن است. «أَمَداً»: مدّت زمان طولانی (نگا: آل‌عمران / 30، کهف / 12، حدید / 16).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو نمی‌دانم آنچه به شما وعده داده‌اند نزدیک است، یا پروردگار من برای آن فاصله‌ای [دراز] قرار داده است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «من نمی‌دانم آنچه به شما وعده داده شده نزدیک است یا پروردگارم زمانی برای آن قرارمی‌دهد؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو ندانم آیا نزدیک است آنچه وعده داده شوید یا برنهد برایش پروردگارم سرآمدی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: نمى‌دانم كه آيا آنچه وعده داده مى‌شويد- عذاب- نزديك است يا پروردگارم براى آن مدتى مى‌نهد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «من نمی‌دانم آن چه وعده داده می‌شوید، نزدیک است یا خدا برایش مدتی دور قرار می‌دهد.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Say: "I do not know if what is promised you is near, or if my Lord prolongs its term.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Say (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), “I do not know whether what you are promised is close or if my Lord will postpone it for a while.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'I do not know whether that which you are promised is nigh, or whether my Lord will appoint for it a space;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: know not whather that which ye are promised is nigh, or whether my Lord hath appointed for it a distant term.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Say (O Muhammad SAW): "I know not whether (the punishment) which you are promised is near or whether my Lord will appoint for it a distant term.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “I do not know whether what you are promised is near, or whether my Lord will extend it for a period.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Say: “I know not whether what you are promised is near or whether my Lord will prolong its term.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: "I know not whether that which you are promised is near or whether my Lord will appoint for it a distant term."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say (O Muhammad, unto the disbelievers): I know not whether that which ye are promised is nigh, or if my Lord hath set a distant term for it.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘I do not know if what you are promised is near, or if my Lord has set a [long] term for it.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'I do not know whether that which you are promised is near, or whether my Lord will set for it a time.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Say, "I do not know if what you are promised is near or if my Lord will grant for it a [long] period."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), say, "I do not know whether that with which you have been threatened is close by or whether my Lord will prolong the time of its coming.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Say: I do not know whether that with which you are threatened be nigh or whether my Lord will appoint for it a term:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qul in adree aqareebun ma tooAAadoona am yajAAalu lahu rabbee amadan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Say, "I do not know whether what you are promised is imminent, or whether my Lord has set for it a far-off day.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Say: "I know not whether the (Punishment) which ye are promised is near, or whether my Lord will appoint for it a distant term.

verses.text: عَالِمُ‌ الْغَيْبِ‌ فَلاَ يُظْهِرُ عَلَى‌ غَيْبِهِ‌ أَحَداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [او] دانای غیب است و هیچ کس را بر غیب خود آگاه نمی کند؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: او داناى غيب است و غيب خود را بر هيچ كس آشكار نمى‌سازد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [او] داناى غيب است و كسى را بر غيب خود آگاه نمى‌كند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: داناى نهان است، و كسى را بر غيب خود آگاه نمى‌كند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: او دانای غیب عالم است و هیچ کس را بر غیب خود آگاه نمی‌کند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: داننده‌ی غیب خدا است، و هیچ کسی را بر غیب خود آگاه نمی‌سازد. [[«عَالِمُ»: خبر مبتدای محذوف (هُوَ) یا بدل از (رَبّ) است. «فَلا یُظْهِرُ عَلی غَیْبِهِ»: (نگا: انعام / 59، نمل / 65).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: اوست دانای [راز] پنهان، که هیچ کس را از غیب خویش آگاه نمی‌سازد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: دانای غیب اوست و هیچ کس را بر اسرار غیبش آگاه نمی‌سازد،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: دانای نهان پس آگاه (یا چیره) نگرداند بر نهان خویش کسی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: داناى نهان و ناپيداست، پس كسى را بر غيب خود آگاه نسازد،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (خدا) عالِم (کل) غیب‌(ها) است، پس احدی را بر غیبش آگاه نمی‌کند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He is the knower of the Unknown, and He does not divulge His secret to any one

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The All Knowing of all the hidden does not give anyone the control over His secrets.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Knower He of the Unseen, and He discloses not His Unseen to anyone,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He is the Knower of the unseen, and He discloseth not His unseen Unto anyone.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "(He Alone) the All-Knower of the Gha'ib (unseen), and He reveals to none His Gha'ib (unseen)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: The Knower of the Invisible; He does not disclose His Invisible to anyone.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He is the Knower of the Unseen, and He does not disclose His Unseen to anyone

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "The All-Knower of the Unseen, and He reveals to none His Unseen."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: (He is) the Knower of the Unseen, and He revealeth unto none His secret,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Knower of the Unseen, He does not disclose His [knowledge of the] Unseen to anyone,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He is the Knower of the Unseen and does not disclose His Unseen to anyone,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [He is] Knower of the unseen, and He does not disclose His [knowledge of the] unseen to anyone

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He knows the unseen and He does not allow anyone to know His secrets except those of His Messengers whom He chooses.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: The Knower of the unseen! so He does not reveal His secrets to any,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: AAalimu alghaybi fala yuthhiru AAala ghaybihi ahadan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He alone has knowledge of what is hidden. He reveals this to none,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "He (alone) knows the Unseen, nor does He make any one acquainted with His Mysteries,-

verses.text: إِلاَّ مَنِ‌ ارْتَضَى‌ مِنْ‌ رَسُولٍ‌ فَإِنَّهُ‌ يَسْلُکُ‌ مِنْ‌ بَيْنِ‌ يَدَيْهِ‌ وَ مِنْ‌ خَلْفِهِ‌ رَصَداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: مگر پیامبرانی را که [برای آگاه شدن از غیب] برگزیده است، پس نگهبانانی [برای محافظت از آنان] از پیش رو و پشت سرشان می گمارد

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مگر بر آن پيامبرى كه از او خشنود باشد كه براى نگهبانى از او پيش روى و پشت سرش نگهبانى مى‌گمارد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: مگر پيامبرى را كه [براى اين امر] بپسندد كه از پيش رو و پشت سرش مراقبانى گسيل مى‌دارد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: جز پيامبرى را كه از او خشنود باشد، كه [در اين صورت‌] براى او از پيش رو و از پشت سرش نگاهبانانى بر خواهد گماشت،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: مگر آن کس را که به پیامبری برگزیده است که فرشتگان را از پیش رو و پشت سر او می‌فرستد (تا اسرار وحی را شیاطین به سرقت گوش نربایند).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مگر پیغمبری که خدا از او خوشنود باشد. خدا (برای حفظ آن مقدار غیبی که او را از آن مطّلع می‌کند، از میان فرشتگان) محافظان و نگهبانانی در پیش و پس او روان می‌دارد. [[«إِلاّ مَنِ ارْتَضی مِن رَّسُولٍ»: مگر پیغمبری که از او راضی باشد. خداوند تنها برخی از پیغمبران را بر بعضی از امور غیب مطّلع می‌سازد، آن هم بدان اندازه که بیانگر معجزات ایشان بوده و به مأموریّت و دعوتشان مربوط باشد (نگا: آل‌عمران / 49 و 179). «إِرْتَضی»: (نگا: انبیاء / 28، نور / 55). «یَسْلُکُ»: داخل می‌کند. روان می‌سازد (نگا: جنّ / 17). «بَیْنَ یَدَیْهِ وَ مِنْ خَلْفِهِ»: مراد همه جوانب و اطراف است. در وقت نزول غیب، خدا توسّط فرشتگان، پیغمبران را از هر سو می‌پاید، و از شیاطین و پریان و وسوسه‌های ایشان مراقبت و مواظبت می‌نماید (نگا: حجر / 9، شعراء / 212). «رَصَداً»: جمع راصِد، نگهبانان و مراقبان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: مگر پیامبری که او بپسندد، که پیشاپیش و پشت سر او نگهبانانی راه دهد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: مگر رسولانی که آنان را برگزیده و مراقبینی از پیش رو و پشت سر برای آنها قرار می‌دهد...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: جز آنکو پسندد از فرستاده‌ای که می‌رود پیش رویش و از پشت سرش نگهبانی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: مگر آن را كه به پيامبرى پسندد و برگزيند، زيرا كه از پيش روى و از پشت سرش نگهبانانى گسيل مى‌دارد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: مگر کسی از رسولان را. پس او بی‌گمان از پیش و پس او مترصد است،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Other than an apostle He has chosen, when He makes a sentinel walk in front of him and a sentinel behind,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Except to His chosen Noble Messengers – so He appoints guards in front and behind him. (Allah gave the knowledge of the hidden to the Holy Prophet – peace and blessings be upon him.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: save only to such a Messenger as He is well-pleased with; then He despatches before him and behind him watchers,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Save Unto an apostle chosen. And then He causeth to go before him and behind him a guard.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Except to a Messenger (from mankind) whom He has chosen (He informs him of unseen as much as He likes), and then He makes a band of watching guards (angels) to march before him and behind him.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Except to a Messenger of His choosing. He then dispatches guards before him and behind him.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: other than to a Messenger whom He chooses (for the bestowal of any part of the knowledge of the Unseen), whereafter He appoints guards who go before him and behind him,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Except to a Messenger whom He has chosen, and then He makes a band of watching guards to march before him and behind him.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Save unto every messenger whom He hath chosen, and then He maketh a guard to go before him and a guard behind him

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: except to an apostle He approves of. Then He dispatches a sentinel before and behind him

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: except only to a Messenger that He has chosen, and He sends guardians before him and behind him,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Except whom He has approved of messengers, and indeed, He sends before each messenger and behind him observers

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He causes angelic guards to march before and after him.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Except to him whom He chooses as an apostle; for surely He makes a guard to march before him and after him,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Illa mani irtada min rasoolin fainnahu yasluku min bayni yadayhi wamin khalfihi rasadan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: except the messenger whom He has chosen. He sends down guardians who walk before them and behind them,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Except a messenger whom He has chosen: and then He makes a band of watchers march before him and behind him,

verses.text: لِيَعْلَمَ‌ أَنْ‌ قَدْ أَبْلَغُوا رِسَالاَتِ‌ رَبِّهِمْ‌ وَ أَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ‌ وَ أَحْصَى‌ کُلَ‌ شَيْ‌ءٍ عَدَداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: تا مشخص کند که پیام های پروردگارشان را [به طور کامل به مردم] رسانده اند و او به آنچه نزد آنان است احاطه دارد، و همه چیز را از جهت عدد، شماره و احصا کرده است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: تا بداند كه آنها پيامهاى پروردگارشان را رسانيده‌اند و خدا به آنچه در نزد آنهاست احاطه دارد و همه چيز را به عدد شمار كرده است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: تا بداند كه محققا پيام‌هاى پروردگار خود را رسانده‌اند و [خدا] بدانچه نزد ايشان است احاطه دارد و هر چيزى را به عدد بر شمرده است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: تا معلوم بدارد كه پيامهاى پروردگار خود را رسانيده‌اند؛ و [خدا] بدانچه نزد ايشان است احاطه دارد و هر چيزى را به عدد شماره كرده است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: تا بداند (و معلوم سازد) که آن رسولان پیغامهای پروردگار خود را به خلق کاملا رسانیده‌اند، و البته خدا به آنچه نزد رسولان است احاطه کامل دارد و به شماره هر چیز در عالم به خوبی آگاه است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: تا خدا بداند که پیغمبران پیامهای پروردگارشان را رسانده‌اند، هر چند که خدا از همه‌ی چیزهائی که نزدیک ایشان است (و در درون و بیرون آنان است) کاملاً آگاه بوده و بدانها احاطه دارد، و هر چیزی را دانه‌دانه سرشماری کرده است و دقیقاً می‌داند. [[«لِیَعْلَمَ»: (نگا: بقره / 143، آل‌عمران / 140). «عَدَداً»: شماره. شمرده. شمرنده. یکی‌یکی. تمییز است، و یا به معنی (إحصاء) و مفعول مطلق است، و یا این که در معنی (مَعْدُوداً) و حال (کُلَّ شَیْءٍ) و یا به معنی (عادّاً) و حال فاعل فعل (أَحْصی) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: تا معلوم بدارد که رسالت پروردگارشان را گزارده‌اند و به آنچه نزد آنان است احاطه دارد، و هر چیز را به شماره می‌شمارد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: تا بداند پیامبرانش رسالتهای پروردگارشان را ابلاغ کرده‌اند؛ و او به آنچه نزد آنهاست احاطه دارد و همه چیز را احصاء کرده است!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: تا بداند که همانا رساندند پیامهای پروردگار خویش را و فراگرفته است بدانچه نزد ایشان است و بشمرد (یا بپایان رساند) است همه چیز را بشمار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: تا معلوم كند كه پيامهاى پروردگارشان را رسانده‌اند، و [خداى‌] آنچه را نزد ايشان

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: تا نشانه نهد که به‌درستی، رسالت‌های پروردگارشان را ابلاغ کرده‌اند. حال آنکه به آن چه نزدشان است، احاطه کرده و عدد هر چیزی (به‌خوبی) را برشمرده است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So that He may know if they have delivered their Lord's messages. He comprehends all that has been given them, and keeps count of everything.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: In order to see that they have conveyed the messages of their Lord – and His knowledge encompasses all whatever they have, and He has kept all things accounted for.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: that He may know they have delivered the Messages of their Lord; and He encompasses all that is with them, and He has numbered everything in numbers.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: That He may know that they have preached the message of their Lord. And He comprehendeth whatever is with them, and He keepeth count of everything numbered.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: [He (Allah) protects them (the Messengers)], till He sees that they (the Messengers) have conveyed the Messages of their Lord (Allah). And He (Allah) surrounds all that which is with them, and He (Allah) keeps count of all things (i.e. He knows the exact number of everything).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: That He may know that they have conveyed the messages of their Lord. He encompasses what they have, and has tallied everything by number.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: so that He may know that they have delivered the messages of their Lord. He encompasses in His knowledge their surroundings and keeps a count of all things.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Till he knows that they have conveyed the Messages of their Lord. And He surrounds all that which is with them, and He keeps count of all things.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: That He may know that they have indeed conveyed the messages of their Lord. He surroundeth all their doings, and He keepeth count of all things.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: so that He may ascertain that they have communicated the messages of their Lord, and He encompasses all that is with them, and He keeps an count of all things.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: so that He may know that they have delivered the Messages of their Lord and He encompasses all that is with them, and He has counted everything innumbers'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: That he may know that they have conveyed the messages of their Lord; and He has encompassed whatever is with them and has enumerated all things in number.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Messenger) so that He would know that the Messengers have conveyed the message of their Lord. He encompasses all that is with them and He keeps a precise account of all things".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So that He may know that they have truly delivered the messages of their Lord, and He encompasses what is with them and He records the number of all things.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: LiyaAAlama an qad ablaghoo risalati rabbihim waahata bima ladayhim waahsa kulla shayin AAadadan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: so that He may know that the messengers have delivered the messages of their Lord. He encompasses all that is with them and He keeps count of all things.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "That He may know that they have (truly) brought and delivered the Messages of their Lord: and He surrounds (all the mysteries) that are with them, and takes account of every single thing."
